description: Smallest number larger than the previous term which is not a prime but is relatively prime to the previous term.
references: A. Murthy, Exploring some new ideas on Smarandache type sets, functions and sequences, Smarandache Notions Journal Vol. 11, N 1-2-3 Spring 2000
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
maple: with(numtheory); i:=4; k:=5; while(k < 100) do while(order(k, i) = FAIL or isprime(k)) do k:=k+1; end do; print(k); i:= k; k:=k+1; end do; # _Ben Paul Thurston_, Feb 08 2007
mathematica: rPrimeNext[n_]:=Module[{k},k=n+1;While[PrimeQ[k]||GCD[n,k]!=1,k++ ];k]; a=1;lst={a};Do[AppendTo[lst,a=rPrimeNext[a]],{n,0,5!}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, May 15 2010 *)nxt[n_]:=Module[{k=n+1},While[PrimeQ[k]||!CoprimeQ[k,n],k++];k]; NestList[ nxt,1,60] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 12 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a051884 n = a051884_list !! (n-1)a051884_list =  1 : f 1 a002808_list where   f x cs = y : f y (dropWhile (<= y) cs) where     y = head [z | z <- cs, x `gcd` z == 1]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 03 2013
author: _Felice Russo_, Dec 15 1999
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Dec 16 1999
Definition corrected by _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Sep 19 2006
